sentences: kui kell kukub, on tööaeg läbi.
context: The word 'kukub' is the 3rd person singular present form of the verb 'kukkuma' in Estonian. It means 'to fall', 'to drop', or 'to collapse'. In the context shown from the dictionary definition, it's used with 'kell' (clock) to indicate when a specific predetermined time arrives or is completed - 'when the clock falls [meaning strikes/indicates the hour]'. The word can refer to physical falling or dropping of objects or people, but in the temporal sense shown, it indicates when time has arrived for something.
